citation.article-title: Prochlorococcus marinus Chisholm et al. 1992 subsp. pastoris subsp. nov. strain PCC 9511, the first axenic chlorophyll a2/b2-containing cyanobacterium (Oxyphotobacteria).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Prochlorococcus marinus subsp. marinus subsp. nov.

The type strain of this subspecies is the non-axenic holotype of the genus, strain CCMP 1375T. The cells are spherical to slightly elongated (0.6-0.8 μm in diameter; pre-divisional cells are 1.2-1.6 μm in length) ; thylakoids are arranged concentrically at the periphery of the cells; the genes encoding the a and b subunits of phycoerythrin (PEIII) are present and translated; chlorophylls a2, b1, b2 and Mg, 3-8 divinyl phaeoporphyrin a5 are synthesized; the ratios of chlorophyll b (b1 and b2) over chl a2 are in the range of 0.4-2.4. Zeaxanthin and α-carotene are the major carotenoids. The mean DNA base composition and genome size are unknown.
